thread.title: Tim Emmony makes Accountancy Age "35 Under 35"

author: Tom Pegden
title: Tim Emmony makes Accountancy Age "35 Under 35"
text:
Tim Emmony makes Accountancy Age "35 Under 35" He is boss of MNE Accounting, which prides itself on being different to more traditional firms Share Tim Emmony: "I didn't want MNE to be just another accountancy firm in the market." Share Get Business
The boss of a city accounting business has made it on to The Accountancy Age "35 Under 35" list for 2018.
Tim Emmony has made it to number 33 in the annual list which spotlights rising talent in the accountancy industry, singling out those who have made outstanding contributions to their field in their career to date.
He is managing director of MNE Accounting, which is based in Upper Brown Street, and offers financial guidance, book-keeping support and accountancy services to businesses, including many in the capital.
It has grown rapidly since its launch in 2012, after Tim tried to make it stand out from more traditional firms.
In its rankings the Accountancy Age website said: "Emmony established MNE Accounting five years ago with the ambition of building a dynamic and ambitious firm.
"He works with clients at the finance director level, advising on strategy and management, and oversees financial accounting at the firm, managing personal tax and end of year accounts.
"Client retention at MNE Accounting currently stands at over 90 per cent." Read More Brexit Comment: ‘Many have accused the EU of being on life support – but NAFTA is also in intensive care’
Tim said: "I didn't want to set up MNE as just another accountancy firm in the market.
The vast majority of our team at MNE are under 35 which means we can bring a more modern approach to accountancy. Read More
"I'm absolutely delighted to be listed in The Accountancy Age's 35 under 35 because for me this is recognition and appreciation that MNE is shaking things up in the industry." Like us on Facebook
